oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-05-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-05-12 part 1. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Roy Rowan, starring Count Basie and his Orchestra with vocalist Joe Williams, and special guest stars the Robins, and Kitty White. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Count Basie Orchestra; Joe Williams; Robins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Alan Freed) -- Opening theme (Roy Rowan) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- Dinner With Friends (Count Basie Orchestra) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces Joe Williams -- (Love Is) The Tender Trap (Joe Williams, Count Basie Orchestra) -- Alan Freed introduces the Robins -- Out Of The Picture (Robins) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed and Count Basie talk -- April In Paris (Count Basie Orchestra) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Rowan, Roy; Basie, Count, 1904-1984; Count Basie Orchestra; Williams, Joe, 1918-1999; Payne, Sonny, 1926-1979; Robins (Musical group); White, Kitty; Melamed, Louis
